docs.summary:
Provides functionality for elements that can be hidden.

 To learn about the behavior of a hidden element,
 see the [`hidden`](#hidden) property.
Indicates if the element is visible or hidden.
description: If `hidden` is `true`, the element is not displayed on the page under
any circumstances. A hidden element, unlike a
take up the same space on the page as it did when it was visible.
If `hidden` is `false`, the element _may_ be displayed on the page.
However, an element whose `hidden` property is `false` is still not
+ Its [parent element]($w.Node.html#parent) is hidden or collapsed.
+ It is a slide in a [Slideshow]($w.Slideshow.html) which is
Even if the element is not displayed due to the conditions
mentioned above, if its `hidden` property is set to `false`, it's
displayed when the conditions no longer apply.
To determine if the element is actually visible, use the
To set the `hidden` property on an element, use the element's
If you select **Hidden on load** in the element's Properties panel
in the Editor, the `hidden` property is set to `true` when the page loads.

examples.title: Get an element's hidden status
Toggle an element's hidden state

notes:
An element's `hidden` property is not the same as its
  [isVisible](#isVisible) property. The `hidden` property
  indicates whether the element _should_ be displayed, while `isVisible`
  indicates if it is actually displayed.

docs.summary: Indicates if the element is actually visible.
description: If `isVisible` is `true`, the element is displayed on the page.
If `isVisible` is `false`, the element is not displayed on the page.
The value of the `isVisible` property is calculated based on the
properties of the element and all of its ancestors. It is `true`
only if the conditions exist in the element's property values and the
property values of its ancestors such that the element is actually

examples.title: Get whether an element is visible

notes:
An element's `isVisible` property is not the same as its
 [hidden]($w.Element.html#hidden) property. The `isVisible` property
 indicates whether the element is actually displayed, while `hidden`
 indicates if it _should_ be displayed.

 The `isVisible` property of an element remains `true` even if
 another element completely covers it so that a user cannot see it.

params.name: effectName
params.doc:
The name of the
 effect to play when hiding the item.

ret.doc: on fulfilled - When the effect is complete and the element's `hidden` property has been set to `true`.

docs.summary:
Hides the element and sets its `hidden` property
 to `true`, using an effect if specified.
description: The `hide()` function hides the element and returns a Promise that is
resolved when the effect is complete and the element's [`hidden`](#hidden)
To learn about the behavior of a hidden element,
You can optionally apply an effect when hiding the element by providing
an `effectName` value. You can also customize the effect by providing the
You can also hide an element
when the page loads by using the Properties panel in the Editor.

examples.title: Hide an element with no effect
Hide an element with the "fade" effect
Hide an element with an effect and log message when the effect is done
Hide an element with an effect and log message when the effect is done
Toggle an element's hidden state

params.name: effectName
params.doc:
The name of the
 effect to play when showing the item.

ret.doc: on fulfilled - When the effect is complete and the element's `hidden` property has been set to `false`.

docs.summary:
Shows the element and sets its `hidden` property
 to `false`, using an effect if specified.
description: The `show()` function shows the element and returns a Promise that is
resolved when the effect is complete and the element's [`hidden`](#hidden)
You can optionally apply an effect when showing the element by providing
an `effectName` value. You can also customize the effect by providing the
